item.title: Bio
item.content:encoded:
Hi there!

…

Originally from Nebraska, I moved to California to attend Stanford University. While at Stanford I studied Computer Science, with a focus on information and data. This track utilizes techniques like machine learning and data mining and applies it to a variety of areas, such as data models, security, and NLP. Through internship experience and classroom projects, I have applied my computing knowledge to projects ranging from a web tool focused on the revitalization of the Yup’ik Language to implementing reinforcement learning algorithms to effectively play the card game skull.

I also pursued a minor in Native American studies, which offered a great balance to my technical coursework. The small class sizes of Native Studies courses provided an intimate environment and required active participation for discussion of the material. The minor enhanced my ability effectively articulate and defend complex topics and gave me perspective on issues that impact contemporary Natives.

Outside of academics, I like to keep busy. You can find me scrolling through the Twitter pages of many of NASA’s missions or playing boardgames with friends, like Santorini and Splendor. I also like to be active, I enjoy activities like running, Core Power, and a backpacking with friends. To see some highlights of some of my backpacking trips and other travel adventures, check out my travel page, which I added just for fun.

item.title: Quote
item.content:encoded:
“Sometimes it is the people no one imagines anything of who do the things no one can imagine. ”

The imitation game

item.title: Internships
item.content:encoded:
Internships

 

PwC

Cybersecurity and privacy summer associate | Summer 2018

I spent 12 weeks working for PwC’s advisory in their cybersecurity practice out of the San Francisco office. My client was a large tech company and I worked on their Bug Bounty program. I have long been interested in cybersecurity and it was an incredibly informative experience learning what one aspect of cyber looks like in practice.

Bug Bounty

As part of Bug Bounty I used worked with HackerOne to verify and triage reported vulnerabilities and then used this information to create tickets in Jira. Additionally, I created fixes for issues such as XSS and subdomain takeovers and validated the successful fix of dozens of bugs. Throughout this, I updated researchers on the status of bounties.

Assignment Tool

Assigning tickets for fixing was often a tedious process that often required checking multiple databases and sources before an assignee could be determined. I saw this as an opportunity to bring value by building a dynamic web tool automate parts of this search process. Using Google Apps Script and Python, I created a tool to perform API calls, parse the information, and map the data to locate the owner of domains. While it was just a prototype, the feedback on the tool was and plans were made to build it out further.

Feedback

At the end of the summer, I received a return offer to work full-time in the San Francisco Office.

Raytheon

Software Engineering Intern | Summer 2017

Coverity

I extended Coverity Software coverage through the development of a series of static analysis checkers in C++, which detect security vulnerabilities in internal code bases written in C.

Cyber Guidelines

I produced a database of next-generation best practice guidelines for hardware components based on recent publications on cyber countermeasures in control-flow integrity and hardware debugging.

Feedback

I was selected to present my summer work to the regional cyber team and ended the summer receiving a return offer.

Stanford Center for International Security and Cooperation

Cyber Research Intern | Summer 2016

+ Worked under the instruction of Dr. Herb Lin, Senior Researcher in Cyber Policy and Security

+ Constructed cybersecurity related data such as policy briefings and educational papers on topics like attribution and health

item.title: Technical Projects
item.content:encoded:
Technical Projects

 

Yup’ik/ English Language Translation Tool

Python

+ Created a Python script to parse a PDF and construct the backend data structure of a more accessible and comprehensive translation tool to help preserve the indigenous Yup’ik language

+ Project won first place at the 2017 AISES National Conference miniHackathon

Skull Playing Agent

Python, Julia

+Used Reinforcement Learning Algorithms to create an agent to make optimal decisions in the card game, Skull

+ Final Project for Decision Making Under Uncertainty.

Movie Recommender Chatbot

Python

+ Implemented a interactive Chatbot that recommended movies based on user’s preferences and sentiment; incorporated Naive Bayes, stemming, regular expressions, and logarithmic based recommendations

+Final Project for From Languages to Information (NLP)

JavaScript, CSS

Dora Activity Recommender

item.title: Travel
item.content:encoded:
“We’re so busy watching out for what’s just ahead that we don’t take time to enjoy where we are. “

-Calvin and Hobbes

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2499.0"] Parasailing over Medellin, Colombia | September 2015 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1932.0"] Backpacking in the Redwoods National Forrest, CA | June 2016 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1334.0"] Camping in Yosemite National Park, CA | July 2016 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2499.0"] Views from Fiesole, a day trip outside of Florence, Italy. | September 2016 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Backpacking in Joshua Tree National Park, CA | December 2016 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2499.0"] Swimming through the waters of Semuc Champay, Guatemala | March 2017 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Hiking around Lake Atitlán in Guatemala | April 2017 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Day Trip to Big Sur, CA | May 2017 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2499.0"] Camping in Yellowstone National Park, WY | September 2017 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Backpacking through Point Reyes National Seashore | February 2018 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2499.0"] Views from La Piedra in Guatapé, Colombia | March 2018 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2499.0"] Exploring caves in Halong Bay, Vietnam | September 2018 [/caption]
